question: GATE CSE 2004

Host A is sending data to host B over a full duplex link. A and B are using the sliding window protocol for flow control. The send and receive window sizes are 5 packets each. Data packets (sent only from A to B) are all 1000 bytes long and the transmission time for such a packet is 50 µs. Acknowledgement packets (sent only from B to A) are very small and require negligible transmission time. The propagation delay over the link is 200 us. What is the maximum achievable throughput in this communication?

GATE CSE 2003

A 2 km long broadcast LAN has 10⁷ bps bandwidth and uses CSMA/CD. The signal travels along the wire at 2 × 10⁸ m/s. What is the minimum packet size that can be used on this network?

GATE CSE 2003

The subnet mask for a particular network is 255.255.31.0 Which of the following pairs of IP addresses could belong to this network ?

GATE CSE 2003

Which of the following functionalities must be implemented by a transport protocol over and above the network protocol ?

GATE-CS-2003
option_3: Packet delivery in the correct order

question:
Which of the following assertions is FALSE about the Internet Protocol (IP) ?

GATE CS 2003
option_1: It is possible for a computer to have multiple IP addresses
option_2: IP packets from the same source to the same destination can take different routes in the network
option_3: IP ensures that a packet is discarded if it is unable to reach its destination within a given number of hops
option_4: The packet source cannot set the route of an outgoing packets; the route is determined only by the routing tables in the routers on the way

question:
In serial data transmission, every byte of data is padded with a ‘0’ in the beginning and one or two ‘I’ s at the end of byte because

GATE CS 2002
option_1: Receiver is to be synchronized for byte reception
option_2: Receiver recovers lost ‘0’ and ‘1’s from these padded bits
option_3: Padded bits are useful in parity computation

question:
In serial communications employing 8 data bits, a parity bit and 2 stop bits, the minimum band rate required to sustain a transfer rate of 300 characters per second is

GATE CS 1998

Purpose of a start bit in RS-232 serial communication protocol is:

GATE CSE 1997
option_1: to synchronize receiver for receiving every byte
option_2: to synchronize receiver for receiving a sequence of bytes
option_4: to synchronize receiver for receiving the last byte

question:
What is the distance of the following code 000000, 010101, 000111, 011001, 111111?

GATE CSE 1995

Start and stop bits do not contain any "information" but are used in serial communication for

GATE CSE 1992

Choose the correct alternatives (more than one may be correct) and write the corresponding letters only:

GATE CSE 1992
option_1: Start and stop bits do not contain any 'information' but are used in serial communication Error detection

question:
TCP client P successfully establishes a connection to TCP server Q.

Let 𝑁𝑃 denote the sequence number in the SYN sent from P to Q.

Let 𝑁𝑄 denote the acknowledgment number in the SYN-ACK from Q to P.

Which of the following statements is/are CORRECT?

A. The sequence number 𝑁𝑃 is chosen randomly by P

B. The sequence number 𝑁𝑃 is always 0 for a new connection

C. The acknowledgment number 𝑁𝑄 is equal to 𝑁𝑃

D. The acknowledgment number 𝑁𝑄 is equal to 𝑁𝑃 + 1

GATE CSE 2024 SET-1

A user starts browsing a webpage hosted at a remote server. The browser opens a single TCP connection to fetch the entire webpage from the server. The webpage consists of a top-level index page with multiple embedded image objects. Assume that all caches (e.g., DNS cache, browser cache) are all initially empty. The following packets leave the user's computer in some order.

(i) HTTP GET request for the index page

(ii) DNS request to resolve the web server's name to its IP address

(iii) HTTP GET request for an image object

(iv) TCP SYN to open a connection to the web server

Which one of the following is the CORRECT chronological order (earliest in time to latest) of the packets leaving the computer ?

GATE CSE 2024 SET-1

Suppose in a web browser, you click on the www.gate-2023.in URL. The browser cache is empty. The IP address for this URL is not cached in your local host, so a DNS lookup is triggered (by the local DNS server deployed on your local host) over the 3-tier DNS hierarchy in an iterative mode. No resource records are cached anywhere across all DNS servers.

Let RTT denote the round trip time between your local host and DNS servers in the DNS hierarchy. The round trip time between the local host and the web server hosting www.gate-2023.in is also equal to RTT. The HTML ﬁle associated with the URL is small enough to have negligible transmission time and negligible rendering time by your web browser, which references 10 equally small objects on the same web server.

Which of the following statements is/are CORRECT about the minimum elapsed time between clicking on the URL and your browser fully rendering it?

GATE CSE 2023
option_1: 7 RTTs, in case of non-persistent HTTP with 5 parallel TCP connections.
option_2: 5 RTTs, in case of persistent HTTP with pipelining.
option_3: 9 RTTs, in case of non-persistent HTTP with 5 parallel TCP connections.
option_4: 6 RTTs, in case of persistent HTTP with pipelining.

question:
Suppose you are asked to design a new reliable byte-stream transport protocol like TCP. This protocol, named my TCP, runs over a 100 Mbps network with a Round Trip Time of 150 milliseconds and a maximum segment lifetime of 2 minutes. Which of the following is/are valid lengths of the Sequence Number ﬁeld in the my TCP header?

A) 30 bits

B) 32 bits

C) 34 bits

D) 36 bits

GATE CSE 2023

Which of the following prefixes in CIDR notation can be collectively used to correctly aggregate all of the subnets in the routing table?

A) 12.20.164.0/20

B) 12.20.164.0/22

C) 12.20.164.0/21

D) 12.20.168.0/22

GATE CS 2022
GATE CS 2022

A) The distance from R to P will be stored as 10

B) The distance from R to Q will be stored as 7

C) The next hop router for a packet from R to P is Y

D) The next hop router for a packet from R to Q is Z

GATE CS 2021

Four nos of 256- byte messages are generated by a sending application and transmitted to a receiving application using TCP. The receiving application will receive:

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017
option_2: a total of 1024 bytes, either as 4 messages of size 256 bytes or as 2 messages of size 512 bytes etc.
option_3: the messages with their boundaries preserved exactly.
option_4: a maximum of half the total size only.

question:
In which kind of communication, the destination address in each packet is the same for all duplicates?

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

How many host interfaces may be addressed in the subnet 123.224.00.00/11?

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

If the data frame is 1101011011 and the divisor is 10011 in a CRC error detection process, a burst error 0000010011 occurs in transmission. Justify whether it will be detected:

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017
option_1: With a high probability, it will be detected.
option_2: It will not be detected, as the burst error is exactly identical to the divisor.
option_3: with a very small probability, it will be detected.
option_4: It depends on the data rate in the channel. So it may or may not be detected.

question: ..........is used to obtain the IP address of a host based on its physical address.

If a IP address starts with a bit sequence of 11110, it is a class..........address.

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

A router must have at least............NICs.

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

In IPV4, using the classful addressing scheme, the whole address space is divided into how many classes:

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

Which of the following are not valid IPV4 addresses?

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

In a stop and wait protocol used across a link of bandwidth of 1Mbps, data packets of 1000 bits are transmitted. The round trip time for a bit is 20ms. The link utilization is :

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

A code with a Hamming distance d can:

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017
option_1: detect d bit errors and correct (d−1) bit errors.
option_2: detect (d−1) bit errors only with no error correction.
option_3: detect (d−1) bit errors and correct (d−1)/2 bit errors.
option_4: detect and correct all d bit errors.

question:
The gateway that stands between the mobile network and the Internet in GPRS is called as........

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

A..........can forward packets across different networks that may also use different protocols:

TRB Poly. Lect. 2017

A TCP message consisting of 2100 bytes is passed to IP for delivery across two networks. The first network can carry a maximum payload of 1200 bytes per frame and the second network can carry a maximum payload of 400 bytes per frame, excluding network overhead. Assume that IP overhead per packet is 20 bytes. What is the total IP overhead in the second network for this transmission?

GATE CS 2004

In the TCP/IP protocol suite, which one of the following is NOT part of the IP header?

GATE CS 2004

Consider a simplified time slotted MAC protocol, where each host always has data to send and transmits with probability p = 0.2 in every slot. There is no backoff and one frame can be transmitted in one slot. If more than one host transmits in the same slot, then the transmissions are unsuccessful due to collision. What is the maximum number of hosts which this protocol can support, if each host has to be provided a minimum through put of 0.16 frames per time slot?

GATE CS 2004

Consider a parity check code with three data bits and four parity check bits. Three of the code words are 0101011, 1001101 and 1110001. Which of the following are also code words?

I. 0010111

II. 0110110

III. 1011010

IV. 0111010

GATE CS 2004

A 20 Kbps satellite link has a propagation delay of 400 ms. The transmitter employs the "go back n ARQ" scheme with n set to 10. Assuming that each frame is 100 bytes long, what is the maximum data rate possible?

GATE CS 2004

Consider a 10 Mbps token ring LAN with a ring latency of 400 µs. A host that needs to transmit seizes the token. Then it sends a frame of 1000 bytes, removes the frame after it has circulated all around the ring, and finally releases the token. This process is repeated for every frame. Assuming that only a single host wishes to transmit, the effective data rate is

In a sliding window ARQ scheme, the transmitter's window size is N and the receiver's window size is M. The minimum number of distinct sequence numbers required to ensure correct operation of the ARQ scheme is

In a data link protocol, the frame delimiter flag is given by 0111. Assuming that bit stuffing is employed, the transmitter sends the data sequence 01110110 as

GATE CS 2004

A serial transmission Ti uses 8 information bits, 2 start bits, 1 stop bit and 1 parity bit for each character. A synchronous transmission T2 uses 3 eight bit sync characters followed by 30 eight bit information characters. If the bit rate is 1200 bits/second in both cases, what are the transfer rates of Ti and T2?

GATE CS 2004

In TCP, a unique sequence number is assigned to each

GATE CS 2004

A host is connected to a Department network which is part of a University network. The University network, in turn, is part of the Internet. The largest network in which the Ethernet address of the host is unique is:

GATE CS 2004
option_1: the subnet to which the host belongs

question:
A subnet has been assigned a subnet mask of 255.255.255.192. What is the maximum number of hosts that can belong to this subnet?

GATE CS 2004

Which one of the following statements is FALSE?

GATE CS 2004
option_1: TCP guarantees a minimum communication rate
option_3: TCP reacts to congestion by reducing sender window size
option_4: TCP employs retransmission to compensate for packet loss

question:
Which one of the following statements is FALSE?

GATE CS 2004
option_1: Packet switching leads to better utilization of bandwidth resources than circuit switching.
option_2: Packet switching results in less variation in delay than circuit switching.
option_3: Packet switching requires more per packet processing than circuit switching
option_4: Packet switching can lead to reordering unlike in circuit switching

question:
Assuming that the packets are correctly delivered, how many bytes, including headers, are delivered to the IP layer at the destination for one application message, in the best case ? Consider only data packets.

GATE CS 2004

is the rate at which application data is transferred to host HC? Ignore errors, acknowledgements, and other overheads.

GATE CS 2004

On which interfaces will the router forward packets addressed to destinations 128.75.43.16 and 192.12.17.10 respectively?

GATE CS 2004

A and B are the only two stations on an Ethernet. Each has a steady queue of frames to send. Both A and B attempt to transmit a frame, collide, and A wins the first backoff race. At the end of this successful transmission by A, both A and B attempt to transmit and collide. The probability that A wins the second backoff race is:

GATE CS 2004
